It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Letter] 1819 Jan. 21, Cairo, Tennessee [to] John Overton / James Winchester
bibl.author: Winchester, James
bibl.note: This is a letter dated January 21, 1819 from James Winchester to John Overton. It is a brief letter of inquiry to Overton concerning the possible establishment of a Post Office at a location known as the Bluff, near the Tennessee River. Winchester mentions Andrew Jackson as a possible ally in the endeavour.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.p: Would it not be well to endeavour to get a post office established at the Bluff, at present to branch off from the Chickasaw agency, untill a direct road is opened from one of the post towns on this side Tennessee river I have no doubt this object may be accomplished by writing in to members of Congress, more especially when Genl Jackson is there (at washington) if asked to use his influence, If you concur in opinion with me you will please to address your friends in Congress on this subject and I will do the same I am not insinuating that I am to name commissioners to you for a certain purpose which shall be done in time I have not yet heard from Baltimore on the subject of the claim of the house of Mrs Winchester as soon as I do you shall hear from me.
div1.closer:
most respectfully Your ob' Servant J WinchesterJudge Overton attended to by J.O. and a Post office established from Reynolds house to the Bluff
Ja Winchester Jany 21 1819 Cairo T. Jan 21 Judge Overton Nashville
